shape.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: the form that something has, for example round, square, triangular etc
shape.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: You can recognize a tree by the shape of its leaves.
His battered old hat had completely lost its shape.
The plants grow in every shape and size.
The children cut out shapes  (=squares, triangles etc) from the piece of cardboard.
The dining room was square in shape.
a silver pin in the shape of a large bird
The wheel had been bent out of shape.
shape.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: in good, bad etc condition, or in good, bad etc health
shape.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: For an old car, it’s in pretty good shape.
The economy is in worse shape now than it was last year.
Kaplan seemed to be in better shape than either of us.
shape.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: in a good or bad state of health or physical fitness
shape.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: I was feeling totally out of shape.
I’ve got to get into shape before summer.
She’s bought an exercise bike to keep in shape.
shape.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: to be sick, tired, drunk etc, and not able to do something well
shape.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: Mel was in no shape to drive home after the party.
shape.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: the way something looks, works, or is organized
shape.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: This new technique is the shape of things to come (=an example of the way things will develop in the future).
Computers have completely changed the shape of our industry.
shape.translation[0].definitions[5].defi: a thing or person that you cannot see clearly enough to recognize
shape.translation[0].definitions[5].exam: A dark shape moved behind them.
shape.translation[0].note_box[0].section: a shape with four straight sides that are equal in length and four angles of 90 degrees
a round shape that is like an O
a shape with three straight sides and three angles
a shape with four straight sides and four angles of 90 degrees
a shape like a circle, but that is longer than it is wide
an object in the shape of a tube
a solid object with six equal square sides
a shape with a square base and four triangular sides that meet in a point at the top
a semicircular arch above the door
The statue is on top of a tall cylindrical column.
The planet Saturn is not completely spherical.
shape.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to influence something such as a belief, opinion etc and make it develop in a particular way
shape.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: People’s political beliefs are shaped by what they see in the papers.
shape.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: to make something have a particular shape, especially by pressing it
shape.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: Shape the dough into small balls.
shape.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: (Supreme Headquarters Allied Powers Europe) the place in Belgium where the Supreme Allied Commander Europe, one of the military commanders of NATO, is based
